author: tristan_wilson
content: geth still hardcodes a max blobs per tx to 6 https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/blob/407d9faf713fa8dfd93282502de89ce93ea66bbe/params/protocol_params.go#L180

author: tristan_wilson
content: we noticed posting to blobs to geth failing after BPO1 on sepolia

author: tristan_wilson
content: "transaction blob limit exceeded: blob count 7, limit 6" is the error we get from geth doing its txpool validation

author: tristan_wilson
content: anyway, created an issue to track it https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/issues/32990

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: We are placing a soft limit on blobs in geth. You can still submit them via other clients, but geth will not accept transactions with more than 6 blobs

author: tristan_wilson
content: ok, thanks for letting me know. https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/9623/files  In here it looks at some point it was part of the EIP but it isn't in the final one https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-7892#execution-layer-configuration

author: tristan_wilson
content: ah it was removed, but simultaneously an across the board 6 blob limit was introduced in a different EIP-7594 https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/commit/cf1a3edbdd400eb85e0819dd36c20206b0bde5be
